0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• 3-dose series, 0.5 mL IM at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Adenocarcinoma in situ of cervix, Virus types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Anal cancer, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Anal intraepithelial neoplasia, Grades 1, 2, and 3; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Cervical cancer, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia, Grade 1, 2, 3; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Genital warts, Virus types 6 and 11; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Malignant tumor of vagina, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Malignant tumor of vulva, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia, Grade 2 and 3; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Vulval intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN), Grade 2 and 3; Prophylaxis: (Women, up to 26 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• 3-dose series, 0.5 mL IM at 0, 2, and 6 months; minimum age for vaccination is 9 years and maximum age for vaccination in boys is 15 years
  • Adenocarcinoma in situ of cervix, Virus types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Anal cancer, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Anal cancer, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Boys, 9 to 15 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Anal intraepithelial neoplasia, Grades 1, 2, and 3; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Anal intraepithelial neoplasia, Grades 1, 2, and 3; Prophylaxis: (Boys, 9 to 15 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Cervical cancer, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia, Grade 1, 2, 3; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Genital warts, Virus types 6 and 11; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Genital warts, Virus types 6 and 11; Prophylaxis: (Boys, 9 to 15 years) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Malignant tumor of vagina, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Malignant tumor of vulva, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia, Grade 2 and 3; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months
  • Vulval intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN), Grade 2 and 3; Prophylaxis: (Girls, 9 years or older) 0.5 mL IM for 3 doses at 0, 2, and 6 months

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Adenocarcinoma in situ of cervix, Virus types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis
  • Anal cancer, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis
  • Anal intraepithelial neoplasia, Grades 1, 2, and 3; Prophylaxis
  • Cervical cancer, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis
  • Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia, Grade 1, 2, 3; Prophylaxis
  • Genital warts, Virus types 6 and 11; Prophylaxis
  • Malignant tumor of vagina, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis
  • Malignant tumor of vulva, Virus types 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58; Prophylaxis
  • Vaginal intraepithelial neoplasia, Grade 2 and 3; Prophylaxis
  • Vulval intraepithelial neoplasia (VIN), Grade 2 and 3; Prophylaxis

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• Hypersensitivity reactions following a dose of Gardasil(R) or Gardasil(R) 9
  • Severe allergic reactions to yeast

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• Cardiovascular:
  • -- Syncope, sometimes associated with tonic-clonic movements and other seizure-like activity, has been reported; tonic-clonic activity is usually transient and responsive to restoring cerebral perfusion (eg, maintaining a supine or Trendelenburg position); observation for 15 minutes following administration is recommended
  • Immunologic:
  • -- Immune response may be decreased in patients who are immunocompromised

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Dermatologic:Erythema at injection site (Boys, 24.9%; girls and women, 34% to 42.3%), Injection site pain (Boys, 71.5%; girls and women, 89.3% to 90.3%), Swelling at injection site (Boys, 26.9%; girls and women, 40% to 49%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (Boys, 9.4%; women and girls, 19.6%)
Serious
Neurologic:Syncope

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine is thought to protect against anogenital diseases caused by HPV types 6, 11, 16, 18, 31, 33, 45, 52, and 58 by inducing a humoral immune response.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
• General Information
    For IM administration only
  • Intramuscular
    • Administer in the deltoid region of the upper arm or in the higher anterolateral area of the thigh
    • Shake well immediately before use; do not dilute or mix with other vaccines
    • Following administration, observe patient for 15 minutes

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: signs of syncope, including tonic-clonic movements and other seizure-like activity; for 15 minutes after administration

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Side effects may include pain, swelling, or erythema at the injection site, and headaches.
  • Instruct patient to complete vaccination series unless contraindicated.
